description:
Peak limiter with configurable threshold, attack, release, hold, and knee.

# Internal Type Used in preset processing layer only. Not available in user or array layers. Path: `/audio/output/speaker/1/preset/peak_limiter`

# Purpose Protects speakers from instantaneous peaks that could cause damage. Fast attack time catches transient peaks before they reach the driver.

# Structure - `bypass`: Enable/disable limiter - `auto`: Auto-threshold mode (adjusts based on signal level) - `threshold`: Maximum output level (1.0-50.0 V RMS) - `attack`: Attack time in seconds (0.0003-0.1s) - how fast limiter engages - `release`: Release time in seconds (0.004-2.0s) - how fast limiter recovers - `hold`: Hold time in seconds (0.0-0.5s) - sustain limiting after peak - `knee`: Soft knee amount (0.0-12.0 dB) - gradual vs hard limiting

# Factory Defaults - Auto mode disabled - Threshold: 1.0 V RMS (minimum, most protective) - Attack: 0.3 ms (very fast) - Release: 4 ms (fast recovery) - Hold: 0 ms (no sustain) - Knee: 0 dB (hard limiting)

attack.description: Attack time in seconds (range: 0.0003-0.1) - how fast limiter engages on peaks

auto.description: Auto-threshold mode - automatically adjusts threshold based on signal level

hold.description: Hold time in seconds (range: 0.0-0.5) - sustain limiting after peak detected

knee.description: Soft knee amount in dB (range: 0.0-12.0) - 0=hard limiting, higher=gradual

release.description: Release time in seconds (range: 0.004-2.0) - how fast limiter recovers after peak

threshold.description: Maximum output level in V RMS (range: 1.0-50.0)

title: PeakLimiter
